trustfund:
TF023976-FAC CONSULTANT TRUST FUND (USD A/C),TF029249-PHRD - COMMUNITY NUTRITION II,TF038590-MADAGASCAR - SUPERVISION OF
            COMMUNITY NUTRITION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Community
            Nutrition Project for Madagascar were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory; risk to development outcome
            was substantial; Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory and borrower performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: community
            participation as the foundation for identifying appropriate
            community-based nutrition activities and mobilizing the
            community's willingness to contribute to the
            implementation of the agreed on nutrition activities. A
            multi-faceted and flexible approach was critical in order
            respond to the communities' diverse needs and readiness
            to take appropriate action. Significant investment must be
            made in training community nutrition workers, social
            workers, school teachers and health staff. Distance and
            inaccessibility to certain sites proved to be important
            limiting factors without obvious solutions. The impact
            analysis showed that results were more pronounced in more
            accessible communities, with better infrastructure, and more
            literate mothers.
